column3: THE FIGURES IN THIS TABLE ARE NOT NATIONAL STATISTICS

column2: Retail Prices Index: Long run series: 1947 to 2018 1, 2, 3
Key:     - zero or negligible      ..   not available
The percentage change in prices between any two months is
((later date index minus earlier date index) divided by earlier date index) times 100
The purchasing power of a sum of money in year X compared with
year Y is calculated using the following formulae:
The sum of money times (later date index divided by earlier date index)
or for the purchasing power in the past:
The sum of money times (earlier date index divided by later date index)
The Retail Prices Index and its derivatives do not meet the required standards
for designation as National Statistics. A full report can be found at:
